result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy T. Shorter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unles previously provided)  and pay surcharge.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Attys are informed that the court has considered the pending charges of the deft in today's sentencing.  In the event the deft is exonerated of these charges, this will be considered a new factor for re-sentencing.  Deft sentenced 2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 18mos WSP followed by 6mos of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Defendant, Jeremy T. Shorter, appeared with Attorney Denise Hertz-Mcgrath.    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   DE pleads guilty; Court finds DE guilty.   Court orders 1 year probation with conditions.  DE to pay court costs and DE to submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Appeals right given.  DNA paperwork given to DE in court.

Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

234 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clk  LE.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court. Defendant requests Jury Trial. DA Pretrial set for 7/24/15  @ 140 p.m. &  Judicial Pretrial set for 8/26/15 @ 1430 p.m. & JS on 9/14/15 @ 9 a.m.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).
